value.body: Closing as Won't Fix. These unit tests require a DB to run. SQLite is the most logical choice in this case. Please make sure you have PDO_SQLite installed for the PHP install that runs the tests.

According to ZF policy all tests have to run on an out-of-the-box php installation.
I used PHP 5.2.5 Win* installation without any modifications except include path.

So when your tests rely on a component which is not available in all OSes you must set these tests to "ignore" if the extention is not found.
Even then I would recommend to make this check in the testbed as when someone has no SqLite Database available the tests should also run without throwing errors. Setting them as ignored is the correct behaviour.
Changing issues in preparation for the 1.7.0 release.
